eg

Class CurrentProject

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.CurrentProject

  • public class CurrentProject
extends java.lang.Object
    The current project that is configured for the file of a TextDocument.

    A project is represented by an object of type ProjectActions.

    A successfully configured project is assigned to this current project and also added to this list of projects. By this any of the listed projects are re-assigned to the current project if the currently set TextDocument belongs to it.

    See also ProjectConfig

    • Method Detail

      • setTextDocument

        public void setTextDocument(TextDocument txtDoc)
        Sets in this the TextDocument which a project is configured for
        Parameters:
        txtDoc - an object of TextDocument

      • isProjectSet

        public boolean isProjectSet()
        If at least one project has been created

      • retrieveLastProject

        public void retrieveLastProject()
        Tries to assign to this the project that was active when the program was closed the last time.

        Method requires that (i) no other project has been assigned before during the lifetime of the program and (ii) the currently set TextDocument is part of last project

      • openSettingsWindow

        public void openSettingsWindow()
        Opens the window of the SettingsWin object of a project.

        Depending on the currently set TextDocument the opened window belongs to the current project, to one of this listed projects that were set before or to a newly created project.

      • changeProject

        public void changeProject()
        Assigns to this current project a project that was previously set during the program's liftime.

        If the currently set TextDocument bolongs to a previous project this project is set active. If it does not belong to a project set before the settings window is opened (same effect as openSettingsWindow()

      • updateFileTree

        public void updateFileTree(java.lang.String dir)
        Adds a file to the file tree if the file belongs to this current project
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory that include the project's directory
